thread.title: Jake Tapper Went All in on Trump's 'Embarrassment' of a Wiretap Claim
thread.title_full: Jake Tapper Went All in on Trump's 'Embarrassment' of a Wiretap Claim

title: Jake Tapper Went All in on Trump's 'Embarrassment' of a Wiretap Claim
text:
Jake Tapper Went All in on Trump's 'Embarrassment' of a Wiretap Claim 
The CNN host pulled no punches. Most Popular By Jack Holmes Mar 17, 2017 These are transformative times for Jake Tapper. Once seemingly seduced by the both-siderist hellscape of Beltway punditry, Tapper has undergone a reinvention in recent months, speaking hard truths to powerful people. That came to a head today with his segment following the joint press conference between President Trump and German Chancellor Angela Merkel, which surely must have had any German viewers who tuned in thinking someone slipped mescaline in their Weihenstephaner.   You see, the president is at this point quintupling down on his evidence-free claim that President Obama had him wiretapped during the campaign. His press secretary, Sean Spicer, managed to cause an international incident Thursday by hitting forward on an email from Uncle Judge Napolitano claiming Obama asked British intelligence to do it—another unfounded claim—and Trump seems to think that was just all fine and dandy. (He even tried to commiserate with Merkel over the idea they were both wiretapped by the Obama administration. Well, Merkel was.) Tapper, it turns out, disagreed: Most Popular This is rarified language from a newsman in the Tapperite mold, but the times call for boldness, bravery, and unvarnished truth. It is an embarrassment, it is making us less safe, and these wild proclamations are damaging the credibility of the United States and its government around the world. More from Esquire:
